Message: Version {me:iati-version(@version)} of the IATI Standard is no longer supported. Please use version 2.
The activity identifier should begin with the organisation identifier of the reporting organisation (or a previous version included in the other-identifier element).
The activity identifier must be unique for each activity.
The activity identifier should be your IATI Organisation Identifier followed by a unique string for the activity separated by a hyphen e.g. COH-1234-activity1
Test (Xpath): $iati-version = '2.03' and not(some $id in (../reporting-org/@ref, ../other-identifier[@type='B1']/@ref) satisfies matches(., functx:escape-for-regex($id) || '-.+'))

Message: The activity identifier must be different to the organisation identifier of the reporting organisation.
The {$identifier} should not start or end with spaces or newlines.
The {$identifier} must not contain any of the symbols /, &, | or ?.
The {$identifier} must start with an approved agency code.

Organisation Identifier must be present.
The {$identifier} must start with an approved agency code.

The {$identifier} should not start or end with spaces or newlines.
The {$identifier} must not contain any of the symbols /, &, | or ?.
The {$identifier} must start with an approved agency code.
When a non OECD DAC sector vocabulary is used, sector vocabulary 1 - OECD DAC should also be used.
The activity should also declare an aid type code from aid type vocabulary 1 - OECD DAC.
Each activity should only contain one default aid type code per aid type vocabulary (e.g. 1 - OECD DAC)
Test (Xpath): count(default-aid-type[@vocabulary=('1','') or not(@vocabulary)]) > 1 or (some $v in (default-aid-type/@vocabulary[. != ('1', '')]) satisfies count(default-aid-type[@vocabulary=$v]) > 1)

Message: The transaction should also contain a code from the OECD DAC aid type vocabulary.
Each transaction should only contain one aid type code per aid type vocabulary (e.g. 1 - OECD DAC)
Test (Xpath): count(aid-type[@vocabulary=('1','') or not(@vocabulary)]) > 1 or (some $v in (aid-type/@vocabulary[. != ('1', '')]) satisfies count(aid-type[@vocabulary=$v]) > 1)

Message: The last updated datetime of the activity must not be in the future.
Test (Xpath): @last-updated-datetime and @last-updated-datetime castable as xs:dateTime and xs:dateTime(@last-updated-datetime) gt $now

Message: The planned start date of the activity must be before the planned end date.
Test (Xpath): activity-date[@type='1']/@iso-date and activity-date[@type='1']/@iso-date castable as xs:date and activity-date[@type='3']/@iso-date and activity-date[@type='3']/@iso-date castable as xs:date and xs:date(activity-date[@type='1']/@iso-date) gt xs:date(activity-date[@type='3']/@iso-date)

Message: The actual start date of the activity must be before the actual end date.
Test (Xpath): activity-date[@type='2']/@iso-date and activity-date[@type='2']/@iso-date castable as xs:date and activity-date[@type='4']/@iso-date and activity-date[@type='4']/@iso-date castable as xs:date and xs:date(activity-date[@type='2']/@iso-date) gt xs:date(activity-date[@type='4']/@iso-date)

Message: The actual start date of the activity must not be in the future.
Test (Xpath): activity-date[@type='2']/@iso-date and activity-date[@type='2']/@iso-date castable as xs:date and xs:date(activity-date[@type='2']/@iso-date) gt xs:date($now)

Message: The actual end date of the activity must not be in the future.
Test (Xpath): activity-date[@type='4']/@iso-date and activity-date[@type='4']/@iso-date castable as xs:date and xs:date(activity-date[@type='4']/@iso-date) gt xs:date($now)

Message: The transaction date must not be in the future.
Test (Xpath): transaction-date/@iso-date and transaction-date/@iso-date castable as xs:date and xs:date(transaction-date/@iso-date) gt xs:date($now)

Message: The transaction value date must not be in the future.
Test (Xpath): value/@value-date and value/@value-date castable as xs:date and xs:date(value/@value-date) gt xs:date($now)

Message: The budget line value date must be within the budget period.
Test (Xpath): @value-date castable as xs:date and ../../period-start/@iso-date and ../../period-start/@iso-date castable as xs:date and ../../period-end/@iso-date and ../../period-end/@iso-date castable as xs:date and (xs:date(@value-date) lt xs:date(../../period-start/@iso-date) or xs:date(@value-date) gt xs:date(../../period-end/@iso-date))

Message: The last updated datetime of the organisation must not be in the future.
Test (Xpath): @last-updated-datetime and @last-updated-datetime castable as xs:dateTime and xs:dateTime(@last-updated-datetime) gt $now

Message: The country/region percentage value must be between 0.0 and 100.0 (inclusive).
Test (Xpath): $iati-version = '2.03' and @percentage castable as xs:decimal and (xs:decimal(@percentage) lt 0 or xs:decimal(@percentage) gt 100)

Message: The country/region percentage value must be 0.0 or positive.
Test (Xpath): $iati-version ne '2.03' and @percentage castable as xs:decimal and xs:decimal(@percentage) lt 0

Message: The percentage value must be between 0.0 and 100.0 (inclusive).
Test (Xpath): $iati-version = '2.03' and @percentage castable as xs:decimal and (xs:decimal(@percentage) lt 0 or xs:decimal(@percentage) gt 100)

Message: The percentage value must be 0.0 or positive.
Test (Xpath): $iati-version ne '2.03' and @percentage castable as xs:decimal and xs:decimal(@percentage) lt 0

Message: The sector percentage value must be between 0.0 and 100.0 (inclusive).
Test (Xpath): $iati-version = '2.03' and @percentage castable as xs:decimal and (xs:decimal(@percentage) lt 0 or xs:decimal(@percentage) gt 100)

Message: The sector percentage value must be 0.0 or positive.
Test (Xpath): $iati-version ne '2.03' and @percentage castable as xs:decimal and xs:decimal(@percentage) lt 0

Message: The percentage value must be a numerical value.
When multiple sectors, within a vocabulary (e.g. 1 - OECD DAC) are declared, each must have a percentage.
Percentage values for sectors, within a vocabulary (e.g. 1 - OECD DAC), {$verb} add up to 100%.
When a single sector is declared, the percentage must either be omitted, or set to 100.
Test (Xpath): $group/@percentage and $group/@percentage castable as xs:decimal and xs:decimal($group/@percentage) !=100

Message: When using a reporting organisation sector code (vocabulary 98 or 99), it must include a narrative.
When multiple recipient countries are declared, each must have a percentage.
Percentage values for recipient countries, {$verb} add up to 100%.
When a single recipient country is declared, the percentage must either be omitted, or set to 100.
Test (Xpath): $group/@percentage and $group/@percentage castable as xs:decimal and xs:decimal($group/@percentage) !=100

Message: When multiple recipient countries or regions are declared, each must have a percentage.
Percentage values for recipient countries or regions, {$verb} add up to 100%.
When a single recipient country or region is declared, the percentage must either be omitted, or set to 100.
Test (Xpath): $group/@percentage and $group/@percentage castable as xs:decimal and xs:decimal($group/@percentage) !=100

Message: Recipient countries or regions must only be declared at activity level OR for all transactions.
Recipient country or recipient region should be declared for either the activity or for all transactions.
If a recipient country OR recipient region is declared for a transaction, they must be used for ALL transactions.
The activity should specify a default language OR the language must be specified for each narrative element.
The title must contain narrative content.
The description must contain narrative content.
The organisation should specify a default language, or the language should be specified for each narrative element.
The document format must be declared.
The participating organisation must have an identifier or a narrative.
The activity must have a planned start date or an actual start date.
When using a reporting organisation policy marker code (vocabulary 99), it must include a narrative.
When using a policy marker code for vocabulary 1, it must include a significance.
The activity status code must be present.
Each activity must have a specified sector, either at activity level OR for all transactions.
The organisation type must be present.
Sectors must only be declared at activity level OR for all transactions.
If sector is declared at transaction level, a sector must be declared for all transactions.
The owner organisation must have an identifier or a narrative.
The provider and receiver organisation must have an organisation identifier or a narrative.
Budget Value must include a Value Date.
Budget Period must not be longer than one year.
Test (Xpath): count(period-start/@iso-date)=1 and period-start/@iso-date castable as xs:date and count(period-end/@iso-date)=1 and period-end/@iso-date castable as xs:date and (xs:date(period-start/@iso-date) + xs:yearMonthDuration('P1Y') lt xs:date(period-end/@iso-date))

Message: The Value must have a specified Currency, or the Activity must have a default Currency.
The financial value must have a specified currency, or the activity must declare a default currency.
When multiple budget items are declared, each must have a percentage.
Percentage values for budget items, {$verb} add up to 100%.
When a single budget item is declared, the percentage must either be omitted, or set to 100.
Test (Xpath): $group/@percentage and $group/@percentage castable as xs:decimal and xs:decimal($group/@percentage) !=100

Message: The actual must have a value when the indicator measure is non-qualitative (e.g. 1 = unit, 2 = percentage, 3 = nominal, 4 = ordinal).
The actual value should be a valid number for all non-qualitative indicator measures (e.g. 1 = unit, 2 = percentage, 3 = nominal, 4 = ordinal).
The actual value should be omitted for qualitative indicator measures.
A reference code must only be declared at result OR result indicator level.
The start date of the indicator period must be before the end date of the indicator period.
Test (Xpath): count(period-start/@iso-date)=1 and period-start/@iso-date castable as xs:date and count(period-end/@iso-date)=1 and period-end/@iso-date castable as xs:date and (period-start/@iso-date gt period-end/@iso-date)

Message: The start of the period must be before the end of the period.
Test (Xpath): count(period-start/@iso-date)=1 and period-start/@iso-date castable as xs:date and count(period-end/@iso-date)=1 and period-end/@iso-date castable as xs:date and (period-start/@iso-date gt period-end/@iso-date)

Message: The baseline must have a value when the indicator measure is non-qualitative (e.g. 1 = unit, 2 = percentage, 3 = nominal, 4 = ordinal).
The baseline value should be a valid number for all non-qualitative measures (e.g. 1 = unit, 2 = percentage, 3 = nominal, 4 = ordinal).
The baseline value should be omitted for qualitative measures.
The target must have a value when indicator measure is non-qualitative (e.g. 1 = unit, 2 = percentage, 3 = nominal, 4 = ordinal).
The target value should be a valid number for all non-qualitative measures (e.g. 1 = unit, 2 = percentage, 3 = nominal, 4 = ordinal)
The target value should be omitted for qualitative measures.
